instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no backlight no display
threads.message:
-----inspection report----------
no green light
jtag corrosion
corrosion on U8130
corrosion between c7323 and c7324
corrosion on q7630
heavy corrosion u6100
corrosion u3510
corrosion q8150
corrosion u1845
corrosion u7840
corrosion u5540
corrosion u5620
--------------dc-in board report---------------
dc-in flex cable corroded, dc-in side
dc-in board corroded around connector
-------------repair report------------------------
jtag removed
200ohms@c7624
ultrasonic-alcohol-oven
no green light
fan spin 1.7 S0_cpu present
folder icon over thunderbolt

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no backlight no display
threads.message: SMC_LID? Known good LCD? U8300 getting 3V to LCD?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no backlight no display
threads.message:
smc_lid 2.6volts
known good. yes, plus customers screen
u8300 -EDP_PANEL_PWR 3.3V measured at R1431

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3437 no backlight no display
threads.message:
sorry, brain fart. replaced dcin board, all good.
even though I dont like being called stupid, i feel stupid, your stick poking just made me $400 so thanks :)
